case_title: Jawwad S. Khawaja vs. Federation of Pakistan

background.allegations: Civilians attacked military installations and public property.
background.government_action: Decided to try 103 civilians under the Pakistan Army Act, 1952.

provisions_challenged.section_2_1_d: Subjects civilians to the Army Act for seducing military personnel or committing offenses under the Official Secrets Act, 1923.
provisions_challenged.section_59_4: Allows civilians accused under Section 2(1)(d) to be tried by military courts.

constitutional_issues: Whether civilians can be tried by military courts under the Army Act.
Whether the provisions violate fundamental rights under Articles 9, 10A, 25, and 175 of the Constitution.
Whether the provisions fall under the exception in Article 8(3)(a) for laws related to the armed forces.

petitioners_arguments.fair_trial_violation: Military courts violate Article 10A (right to fair trial) and lack independence and procedural safeguards.
petitioners_arguments.judicial_independence: Military courts undermine Article 175 (separation of powers).
petitioners_arguments.fundamental_rights: Provisions infringe on Articles 4, 9, and 25 (equality before the law).

respondents_arguments.article_8_3_a: Provisions are exempt from fundamental rights scrutiny as they relate to armed forces.
respondents_arguments.precedents: Relied on F.B. Ali case (1975) to justify military trials of civilians.

judgment.decision: Sections 2(1)(d) and 59(4) of the Pakistan Army Act, 1952, declared unconstitutional.

reasoning.fundamental_rights: Provisions violate Article 10A by denying civilians access to independent and impartial courts.
reasoning.article_8_3_a: Exemption applies only to laws directly related to armed forces members, not civilians.
reasoning.separation_of_powers: Military courts are not part of the judiciary under Article 175.

judgment.trial_direction: Civilians accused in the May 9-10 incidents must be tried in ordinary criminal courts.

key_precedents.f_b_ali_case_1975: Upheld military trials of civilians but did not address Article 10A.
key_precedents.liaquat_hussain_case_1999: Declared military trials of civilians unconstitutional without explicit constitutional amendments.
key_precedents.district_bar_association_case_2015: Allowed temporary military trials under constitutional amendments with a sunset clause.

impact.fundamental_rights: Reaffirmed the supremacy of fundamental rights, particularly the right to a fair trial.
impact.judicial_independence: Limited the jurisdiction of military courts to members of the armed forces.
